title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. V, subch. C, art. 4, pt. 732, subpt. 732-2 - Operations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. V, subch. C, art. 4, pt. 732, subpt. 732-2 - Operations

State Regulations
§ 732-2.1 - Organization and administration
§ 732-2.2 - General operating requirements
§ 732-2.3 - Quality assurance and improvement
§ 732-2.4 - Reimbursement
§ 732-2.5 - Contracts
§ 732-2.6 - Records, reports and information requirements
§ 732-2.7 - Notice and approval required to discontinue operation

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 10, ch. V, subch. C, art. 4, pt. 732, subpt. 732-2
A PPO shall arrange for or provide to claimants
services for the diagnosis, treatment and rehabilitation of any accidental
injury arising out of and in the course of employment and for occupational
disease in accordance with claimant needs. Such care and treatment shall meet
generally accepted professional standards and shall be provided by health care
professionals who are currently licensed, registered or certified as
appropriate and are employed by or under contract with the PPO. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
